intro: Amblyanthera hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Amblyanthera hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates.
